MajorClaims.Text: students should study a broad range of subjects from literature to mathematics
students should find interesting subjects and acquire general knowledge to prepare higher education at tertiary education

Claims.Text: tertiary education should make students prepare for specialization at university
it should be to some extent paternalistic to prevent students from avoiding hurdles
students have to find one or more fields of study in which they are really interested
high school students should learn broadly and prepare future learning at university
schools should be responsible for their future and protect them

Premises.Text: They should not decide their future major without trying a broad range of subjects, otherwise they might miss valuable encounter with the subject
a would-be mathematician student may be strongly intrigued by philosophy and make a success in the field
students should obtain knowledge from a variety of academic fields
General education plays a significant role in specialized education
Science today, for example, is said to be more and more specialized, but in order to solve a problem scientists have to combine knowledge from chemistry to physics
textbooks used in higher education are labelled particular subjects, in fact they require basic understanding of other subjects
you sometimes need knowledge about physics to read a text on chemistry
students have tendency to shun difficulties
They might avoid tough courses, but instead attend mainly Mickey Mouse courses and enjoy themselves too much
This might result in limited choices in the future
